body_html:
I had the same error and I fixed it. Please output "pip --version" and print it here.

If it's similar to "pip 7.1.2 from /usr/local/lib/python3.4/site-packages (python 3.4)" then you are using pip3, run:

sudo easy_install pip

If after you install pip using that command you get a traceback error involving something called six, run:

sudo easy_install -U six

If after you install that (or pip if you didn't get a "six error") and you get a traceback error involving numpy run:

sudo easy_install -U numpy

If all the requirements are met but you get an error saying at the end:

OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/SOMEPACKAGE'

then simply rerun the pip install command with sudo.

Those are all the problems and solutions that I ran across.

body:
I had the same error and I fixed it. Please output "pip --version" and print it here.

If it's similar to "pip 7.1.2 from /usr/local/lib/python3.4/site-packages (python 3.4)" then you are using pip3, run:

sudo easy_install pip

If after you install pip using that command you get a traceback error involving something called six, run:

sudo easy_install -U six

If after you install that (or pip if you didn't get a "six error") and you get a traceback error involving numpy run:

sudo easy_install -U numpy

If all the requirements are met but you get an error saying at the end:

OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/SOMEPACKAGE'

then simply rerun the pip install command with sudo.

Those are all the problems and solutions that I ran across.
